column2: Warning: You must enter a valid hostname. The hostname is the bolded part of the following URL: http://www.example.com/path/index.html

column2: Warning: You must enter a valid path relative to your Magento directory. For example, [Magento]/js would require entering "js"

column1: <u>Only change these values if you are know exactly what you are doing.</u>
column2: <u>Only change these values if you are know exactly what you are doing.</u>

column1: Only enable if you know what you are doing! This feature is experimental and not supported. Warning: Deferring requires changing javascript to be made compatible. View Extendware extensions which are compatible with deferment and we can also resolve javascript incompatabilities with custom development. You must flush js / css cache after changing this setting.
column2: Only enable if you know what you are doing! This feature is experimental and not supported. Warning: Deferring requires changing javascript to be made compatible. You must flush js / css cache after changing this setting.

column1: An error occurred while flushing the cache
column2: An error occurred while flushing the cache

column1: Any javascript inputted here will be executed after the deferred javascript is loaded.
column2: Any javascript inputted here will be executed after the deferred javascript is loaded.

column1: Any javascript inputted here will be executed before the deferred javascript is loaded.
column2: Any javascript inputted here will be executed before the deferred javascript is loaded.

column1: Are you sure you want to flush all optimizer caches?
column2: Are you sure you want to flush all optimizer caches?

column1: Auto-configuration has been disabled in the demo. When you install the extension on your store you can use auto-configuration.
column2: Auto-configuration has been disabled in the demo. When you install the extension on your store you can use auto-configuration.

column1: Auto-configuration is NOT a substitute for configuring manually. Auto-configuration can usually (but not always) pick decent settings to help you get started. After auto-configuration you should review all settings and ensure they work. Do you want to continue?
column2: Auto-configuration is NOT a substitute for configuring manually. Auto-configuration can usually (but not always) pick decent settings to help you get started. After auto-configuration you should review all settings and ensure they work. Do you want to continue?

column1: Auto-configuration will usually configure your site fairly well, but it is not perfect. Please review each configuration item and verify optimum settings have been selected.
column2: Auto-configuration will usually configure your site fairly well, but it is not perfect. Please review each configuration item and verify optimum settings have been selected.

column1: Choosing always or automatic or never is highly recommended
column2: Choosing always or automatic or never is highly recommended

column1: Configuration is already optimal according to auto-configuration. You can review the configuration manually to further optimize as auto-configuration is limited in scope.
column2: Configuration is already optimal according to auto-configuration. You can review the configuration manually to further optimize as auto-configuration is limited in scope.

column1: Could not create directory %s. Please ensure that parent directories have permissions 0777.
column2: Could not create directory %s. Please ensure that parent directories have permissions 0777.

column1: Did you know purchasing %s can speed up your store even more?
column2: Did you know purchasing %s can speed up your store even more?

column1: Disable this if you are NOT using apache. This does not affect your other rewrites.
column2: Disable this if you are NOT using apache. This does not affect your other rewrites.

column1: Disabling this is faster, but will require you to flush the cache if changing js / css.
column2: Disabling this is faster, but will require you to flush the cache if changing js / css.

column1: Enable / disable rewriting of the urls to the JS / CSS. Note: URL rewriting is required for pre-compressing js / css.
column2: Enable / disable rewriting of the urls to the JS / CSS. Note: URL rewriting is required for pre-compressing js / css.

column1: Having different hostnames for different resources can speed up downloads. <u>Only change these values if you are know exactly what you are doing.</u>
column2: Having different hostnames for different resources can speed up downloads. <u>Only change these values if you are know exactly what you are doing.</u>

column1: HTML minification will reduce the size of your HTML page by 4-5% in most cases. If you use our Full Page Cache solution, then this means more pages in the memory cache. Note: Note all themes are compatible. Test after enabling, try different modes, and disable if not compatible with your theme.
column2: HTML minification will reduce the size of your HTML page by 4-5% in most cases. If you use our Full Page Cache solution, then this means more pages in the memory cache. Note: Note all themes are compatible. Test after enabling, try different modes, and disable if not compatible with your theme.

column1: If the request URI matches one of these regexps then javascript / css html will not be minified / merged
column2: If the request URI matches one of these regexps then javascript / css html will not be minified / merged

column1: If the templatefile paths matches one of these regexps then no template optimization will be done
column2: If the templatefile paths matches one of these regexps then no template optimization will be done

column1: If you experience css issues, then try a different compressor. Note: You must check your css URLs after changing this to ensure it is actually minifying. Depending on your php / java path, execution mode, server environment, settings may need to be tweaked for minification to occur.
column2: If you experience css issues, then try a different compressor. Note: You must check your css URLs after changing this to ensure it is actually minifying. Depending on your php / java path, execution mode, server environment, settings may need to be tweaked for minification to occur.

column1: If you experience javascript errors, then try a different compressor. Note: You must check your javascript URLs after changing this to ensure it is actually minifying. Depending on your php / java path, execution mode, server environment, settings may need to be tweaked for minification to occur.
column2: If you experience javascript errors, then try a different compressor. Note: You must check your javascript URLs after changing this to ensure it is actually minifying. Depending on your php / java path, execution mode, server environment, settings may need to be tweaked for minification to occur.

column1: If you have java installed, Closure Compiler is recommended otherwise JSMin
column2: If you have java installed, Closure Compiler is recommended otherwise JSMin

column1: If you have java installed, YUICompressor is recommended otherwise CSS Compressor
column2: If you have java installed, YUICompressor is recommended otherwise CSS Compressor

column1: Input a string and if the file matches it then it will not be merged even if merging always is enabled. Useful for files that cannot be merged well. Example: prototype.js
column2: Input a string and if the file matches it then it will not be merged even if merging always is enabled. Useful for files that cannot be merged well. Example: prototype.js

column1: Leave blank to use the default hostname. This value must be valid or the resource will not load. Note: You must flush site optimizer cache after changing this value.
column2: Leave blank to use the default hostname. This value must be valid or the resource will not load. Note: You must flush site optimizer cache after changing this value.

column1: Leave blank to use the default hostname. This value must be valid or the resource will not load. Rewrites must be disabled for this to work.
column2: Leave blank to use the default hostname. This value must be valid or the resource will not load. Rewrites must be disabled for this to work.

column1: Leave blank to use the default js path. Warning: Only change this if you have technical experience
column2: Leave blank to use the default js path. Warning: Only change this if you have technical experience

column1: Minified and compressed CSS and JS.
column2: Minified and compressed CSS and JS.

column1: Minified non-standard files has occurred. Setting the minifier to none and re-clicking this button can soemtimes restore the original.
column2: Minified non-standard files has occurred. Setting the minifier to none and re-clicking this button can soemtimes restore the original.

column1: Only pick external if you are hitting a memory limit.
column2: Only pick external if you are hitting a memory limit.

column1: Please <u>read the help descriptions, field descriptions, fieldset descriptions, and user guides</u> so you may configure this extension to suit your needs.
column2: Please <u>read the help descriptions, field descriptions, fieldset descriptions, and user guides</u> so you may configure this extension to suit your needs.

column1: Sometimes themes do not follow Magento standards and directly output css files. You can input the relative path of the file to your store (ex: /js/myjs.css). Note: This will directly minify the file, so you should backup the file first. Setting minifier to none will attempt to restore original file. You must click the Minify Non-standard button to minify non-standard files.
column2: Sometimes themes do not follow Magento standards and directly output css files. You can input the relative path of the file to your store (ex: /js/myjs.css). Note: This will directly minify the file, so you should backup the file first. Setting minifier to none will attempt to restore original file. You must click the Minify Non-standard button to minify non-standard files.

column1: Sometimes themes do not follow Magento standards and directly output js files. You can input the relative path of the file to your store (ex: /js/myjs.js). Note: This will directly minify the file, so you should backup the file first. Setting minifier to none will attempt to restore original file. You must click the Minify Non-standard button to minify non-standard files.
column2: Sometimes themes do not follow Magento standards and directly output js files. You can input the relative path of the file to your store (ex: /js/myjs.js). Note: This will directly minify the file, so you should backup the file first. Setting minifier to none will attempt to restore original file. You must click the Minify Non-standard button to minify non-standard files.

column1: Template mode will minify your template files. It makes pages about 4-5% smaller. For well written themes, it should not cause any issues. Page mode will attempt to minify the outputted page and it does it on every requests. It results in 10-15% improvement, but requires processing on every page.
column2: Template mode will minify your template files. It makes pages about 4-5% smaller. For well written themes, it should not cause any issues. Page mode will attempt to minify the outputted page and it does it on every requests. It results in 10-15% improvement, but requires processing on every page.

column1: Test all important site functions after enabling this as themes / extensions that are not compliant with Magento coding standards will give errors.
column2: Test all important site functions after enabling this as themes / extensions that are not compliant with Magento coding standards will give errors.

column1: The cache has been flushed. You will also want to flush the Full Page Cache
column2: The cache has been flushed. You will also want to flush the Full Page Cache

column1: The location of java. Usually "java" or "/usr/bin/java" or "/usr/java/bin/java"
column2: The location of java. Usually "java" or "/usr/bin/java" or "/usr/java/bin/java"

column1: The location to PHP. This is almost always "php" or "/usr/bin/php"
column2: The location to PHP. This is almost always "php" or "/usr/bin/php"

column1: This applies to PHP minifiers only. External mode will invoke a shell script to minify the data. Internal mode will use the current PHP process. External is always used for Java minifiers.
column2: This applies to PHP minifiers only. External mode will invoke a shell script to minify the data. Internal mode will use the current PHP process. External is always used for Java minifiers.

column1: This determins how the HTML is minified.
column2: This determins how the HTML is minified.

column1: This must be a valid regular expression with the beginning and ending "/". For example, /page/. You can read the PHP preg documentation for more information
column2: This must be a valid regular expression with the beginning and ending "/". For example, /page/. You can read the PHP preg documentation for more information

column1: This will minify files in the minify non-standard list. Are you sure you want to proceed?
column2: This will minify files in the minify non-standard list. Are you sure you want to proceed?

column1: Updated to %s. If your host enables exec() you can use a better minifier.
column2: Updated to %s. If your host enables exec() you can use a better minifier.

column1: Updated to %s. If your host installs java you can use a better minifier.
column2: Updated to %s. If your host installs java you can use a better minifier.
